page.title: 14TRAFFIC CENSUS 1ST JULY 1985
page.content: A CENSUS WAS TAKEN AT G.R.560257 BETWEEN 10 & 11 am AND 2 & 3 pm. THE A267 IS THE ONLY MAIN ROAD IN THIS AREA. GENERALLY, NORTHBOUND TRAFFIC HEADS FOR TUNBRIDGE WELLS: SOUTHBOUND TRAFFIC DIVERGES AROUND HEATHFIELD FOR THE SOUTH COAST- HASTINGS, BRIGHTON AND EASTBOURNE. THE RESULTS SHOW A HEAVY PREPONDERENCE OF PRIVATE CARS. SERVICE BUSES ARE ONE PER HOUR IN EITHER DIRECTION UP TO 6.0 pm. BUT ARE UNRELIABLE. MOTOR COACHES ARE SCARCE, AND PART OF THE " THROUGH TRAFFIC ". AGRICULTURAL VEHICLES WERE, IN VIEW OF THE NATURE OF THE AREA, EXTREMELY RARE. OF THE LORRIES AND VANS MOST APPEARED TO BE "THROUGH" TRAFFIC THOUGH THERE WERE THE EXPECTED LOCAL DELIVERY VEHICLES. THE WEATHER WAS FINE AND A GREAT PROPORTION OF THE PRIVATE VEHICLES WOULD HAVE BEEN MAKING FOR THE COASTAL RESORTS.
